raw_text:
Q3 launch notes - draft, not cleaned
Revenue was up 12% vs last quarter but refunds spiked around week 6
New onboarding flow shipped on 8/14; support tickets dropped after that
Marketing says "summer promo" drove most signups, no hard proof
Ops flagged vendor invoice #A19 as late; possible fee next month
Customer churn highest in EU region, unclear if pricing or outages
Action items: tighten refund policy, audit promo tracking, fix EU latency
Budget: ask finance for +$25k for infra, pending approval
Next review scheduled 9/30, bring metrics + incident timeline

facts: Revenue was up 12% vs last quarter.
Marketing says 'summer promo' drove most signups.
Ops flagged vendor invoice #A19 as late.
Possible fee next month due to late invoice.
Customer churn highest in EU region.
Unclear if churn due to pricing or outages.
Budget request: ask finance for +$25k for infra.
Bring metrics and incident timeline to next review.

sections.heading: Customer and Next Steps
bullets: Onboarding flow shipped on 8/14; support tickets dropped.
EU churn is highest; cause unclear.
Next review scheduled 9/30 with metrics and timeline.

summary.tldr: Q3 performance improved but churn and refunds need investigation.
key_points: Support tickets declined after the 8/14 onboarding update.
EU churn is a current hotspot.
risks: Refund spike may indicate product or policy issues.
Potential late fee tied to vendor invoice #A19.
recommendations: Audit refund policy and root causes.
Investigate EU latency and pricing impact on churn.
Tighten promo tracking before next review.
